item.title: A systemd Cheat Sheet
item.description: Generally, systemd is the standard init system across Linux distributions. systemctl is its central CLI management tool. This is a brief overview and cheat sheet. Background systemd is responsible for initializing and managing components, services, and daemons that must be started after the kernel is booted. Such components are often referred to as “userland” components. resources managed by systemd are called units; these are defined in unit files service management unit files are suffixed with a .
